allQuestions.resource: John carried out a survey to find out about the specifications of cars that some people owned
allQuestions.questionText: Based on the diagram, which statement is true about all the cars that were owned by the people John interviewed?
allQuestions.answerReasoning: Some of the cars with parking sensors also have 2 doors - This is correct because the pentagon, which represents cars with parking sensors, is partially inside the arrow, which represents cars with 2 doors. This means that some of the cars with parking sensors also have 2 doors.
allQuestions.questionAnswer: Some of the cars with parking sensors also have 2 doors.
allQuestions.option1: Some of the cars with parking sensors also have 2 doors.
allQuestions.option2: All of the cars with parking sensors have two doors
allQuestions.option3: Some of the cars with leather seats have 2 doors
allQuestions.option4: All of the cars have 2 doors

allQuestions.resource:
50 employees were asked about how they travelled to work each day. 
8 took the train only 
14 took the bus and the train
allQuestions.questionText: If the number of employees that only walked or only took the bus was the same, how many employees only walked?
allQuestions.answerReasoning:
Set A always has three circles with tangents. Other shapes are irrelevant.
Set B always has two circles intersected by lines. Other shapes are irrelevant.
